New Records: Francisco Lindor hit his 31st home run of the season, tying the game in the ninth inning.
Francisco Alvarez hit a three-run shot, his first home run since August 19.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor broke up Bowden Francis' no-hit bid with a tying home run in the ninth inning.
The Mets scored six times in their last at-bat, turning the game around after being down 2-0.
Francisco Alvarez added a three-run shot, contributing significantly to the Mets' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets honored first responders with special caps.
Francisco Lindor needed time to shake off a wasp that landed on his glove.
Post-Match Reflections: John Schneider praised Francisco Francis' evolution and recent performance.
Carlos Mendoza credited Francisco Lindor for energizing the Mets' offense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Rogers Centre with 29,399 attendees.
The Mets have been no-hit eight times, last by Max Scherzer in 2015.
Others: Mets RHP Paul Blackburn returned for imaging on his sore lower back.
Upcoming schedules include the Mets visiting Philadelphia and the Blue Jays hosting St. Louis.
